docs.text:
Welcome to Query




Overview


Query allows you to execute queries against almost any julia data structure.




Installation


This package only works on julia 0.5- and newer. First, clone the package:


Pkg.clone(
https://github.com/davidanthoff/Query.jl.git
)




If you want to use the following packages with Query, you need to check out their $master$ branch first:


Pkg.checkout(
TypedTables
)
Pkg.checkout(
SQLite
)
docs.title: Home

docs.title: Installation

docs.text:
Tutorial


You can use Query to filter and select from a $DataFrame$:


using Query
using DataFrames
using NamedTuples

df = DataFrame(name=[
John
, 
Sally
, 
Kirk
], age=[23., 42., 59.], children=[3,5,2])

x = @from i in df begin
    @where i.age
30. 
 i.children 
 2
    @select @NT(Name=
lowercase(i.name))
    @collect DataFrame
end

println(x)

# output

1×1 DataFrames.DataFrames
│ Row │ Name    │
├─────┼─────────┤
│ 1   │ 
sally
 │
docs.title: Tutorial

docs.text:
You can use Query to filter and select from a $DataFrame$:  using Query
using DataFrames
using NamedTuples

df = DataFrame(name=[ John ,  Sally ,  Kirk ], age=[23., 42., 59.], children=[3,5,2])

x = @from i in df begin
    @where i.age 30.   i.children   2
    @select @NT(Name= lowercase(i.name))
    @collect DataFrame
end

println(x)

# output

1×1 DataFrames.DataFrames
│ Row │ Name    │
├─────┼─────────┤
│ 1   │  sally  │
